info.description: The Azure SQL Database management API provides a RESTful set of web APIs that interact with Azure SQL Database services to manage your databases. The API enables users to create, retrieve, update, and delete databases, servers, and other entities.

put.description: Creates or updates a database's blob auditing policy.

ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for the request.
ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version

ResourceGroupParameter.description: The name of the resource group that contains the resource. You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
ResourceGroupParameter.name: resourceGroupName

SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The subscription ID that identifies an Azure subscription.
SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId

DatabaseBlobAuditingPolicyProperties.description: Properties of a database blob auditing policy.

auditActionsAndGroups.description: Specifies the Actions and Actions-Groups to audit.

isStorageSecondaryKeyInUse.description: Specifies whether storageAccountAccessKey value is the storage’s secondary key.

retentionDays.description: Specifies the number of days to keep in the audit logs.

state.description: Specifies the state of the policy. If state is Enabled, storageEndpoint and storageAccountAccessKey are required.

storageAccountAccessKey.description: Specifies the identifier key of the auditing storage account. If state is Enabled, storageAccountAccessKey is required.

storageAccountSubscriptionId.description: Specifies the blob storage subscription Id.

storageEndpoint.description: Specifies the blob storage endpoint (e.g. https://MyAccount.blob.core.windows.net). If state is Enabled, storageEndpoint is required.
